intro: Orthosia virgata, commonly known as the Virginia orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in rich, sandy soil. Orthosia virgata is an important species for local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
